result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:30 AM Defendant Benjamin J Clark in court.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Benjamin J Clark.  Attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Mark Powers

Adjustment Number: 22A 039626,
Payable Number: 477475,
Amount: $20.00

10:16 AM Defendant Benjamin J Clark in court.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jessica Klein in court for Attorney Mark Powers on behalf of the defendant. Attorney Klein is asking for a brief adjournment to allow for Attorney Powers to be present with the defendant. No objection by the State. The Court will adjourn the preliminary hearing. Time limits were previously waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Benjamin J Clark
Current: 3540 S. Rivershire Drive #6, West Allis, WI 53227 United States  (Effective: 10-04-2022)
Prior: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd., Waukesha, WI 53186 United States
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

COURT ORDERED A $1,500.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $2,500.00 SIGNATURE BOND. 
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and drug testing.   Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

1:11 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Benjamin J Clark in court. 

The Court calls the matter for a WCS non compliance report.
The Court goes over the report with the Defendant.
The Defendant presents statements that he has been to WCS and states he will be putting $250.00 down towards the fees of SCRAM. 
The Defendant states he just got employment. 
The Court admonishes the Defendant and sets $1,500.00 cash bail.
The Defendant taken into custody as he is not able to post.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.**Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on9/7/22 "Issue will be addressed in court today"
WCS non-payment.

1:01 PM Defendant Benjamin J Clark in court.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Benjamin J Clark. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. The Court addresses the WCS non-compliance report filed. Attorney Powers makes statements regarding the defendant's non-appearance and WCS non-compliance. The defendant further elaborates on the WCS non-compliance. The Court admonishes the defendant. Attorney Powers is asking to set this matter for a waiver of a prelim. The Court will set this matter for a waiver of the prelim next week.
Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

EXT=CODE 3

10:25 AM Defendant Benjamin J Clark not in court.  Attorney Jessica Klein in court for Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Benjamin J Clark. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Atty Klein does not know why the Defendant does not appear today. 
State requests to issue a capias, revoke, and forfeit bail. Court orders same.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:07 AM Defendant Benjamin J Clark in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states Atty. Powers will represent him on this case.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court adjourns for status of counsel and status of preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:18 PM Defendant Benjamin J Clark in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney. The Defendant states he would like to retain attorney Powers.
